intro: Varronia lucayana, commonly known as Lucayan varronia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Varronia lucayana is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
